thread.title: Former Farage advisor brands Trump critics ‘cretinous liars’ over Sweden | World | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: Former Farage advisor brands Trump critics ‘cretinous liars’ over Sweden | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Darren Hunt
title: Former Farage advisor brands Trump critics ‘cretinous liars’ over Sweden | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Former Farage advisor brands Donald Trump critics 'cretinous LIARS' over Sweden crisis Former Farage advisor brands Donald Trump critics 'cretinous LIARS' over Sweden crisis FORMER Farage aide Raheem Kassam slammed critics of President Trump for their attacks on him after he made remarks about Sweden’s security situation. PUBLISHED: 11:00, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 | UPDATED: 11:05, Wed, Feb 22, 2017 
The President was criticised after he spoke in Florida on Sunday commenting on security issues as a result of refugees and migrants in Sweden . 
He said: “We've got to keep our country safe. 
“You look at what's happening in Germany. You look at what's happening last night in Sweden. Sweden, who would believe this? Sweden.” 
Donald Trump was faced with huge backlash following his comments as the Swedish Prime Minister stepped in the question the President’s statement. GETTY•FOX Raheem Kassam backed the American President as he was ambushed after Sweden comments Related articles US comedian shockingly jokes about crime levels as Sweden burns 
The billionaire later revealed he was referring to a story broadcast on Fox News concerning immigrants and Sweden. 
On Monday chaos erupted on the streets of Sweden as police were forced to fire at a group of around 30 thugs as they threw stones at officers. 
Mr Kassam backed the US President’s statement as he fired into Mr Trump’s critics, labelling some journalists as “dumb-dumbs”. 
Speaking on Hannity on Fox News , he said: “The president was absolutely manifestly correct on Sweden. I was there just last week in Rosengard in Malmo, in Husby and Rinkeby the suburbs of Stockholm and what I saw was absolutely terrifying. REX FEATURES Rioters plunged the city into chaos as cars were set on fire Shocking images depict violence in Sweden Tue, February 21, 2017
